intro: Rubus mucronatus, commonly known as the prickly blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family and is closely related to other Rubus species.
